column4: for right now I'm not concered bout the workgroup..   I just need to be able to open my Networking..   I have both hardwire and wireless networking.
have you pasted /etc/network/interfaces to the pastebin yet?
I don't know what the pastebin is.
wen you are trying to access wireless, have you disabled the wired one?
disable / inable..   That would be in the "System >> Administration >> Networking"   correct?  If so I cant get it open.
in teminal type 'nano /etc/network/interfaces' and paste it to the pastebin link that ubotu gave above
Okay, I just submitted it.
- http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/12246
Yes.
hit ctrlx to exit that ten type in sudo nano /etc/network/interfaces
then change the line that looks like this 'iface eth1 inet dhcp' to 'iface ath0 inet dhcp'
"sudo: unable to lookup via gethostbyname()"
are you logged in as root?
Yes
you can forget typing sudo then
The sudo not working.  would that be why when I try to open my networking settings it dont open?
if your signed in as root, you dont need to type sudo
: oh..
when you say logged in you mean login root or the username it asked me to create?    is their a diff from root and administrative?
1 sec
here?   or the pastebin?
- http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/12248
